Question
========
You investigate whether attending an premier league soccer game has an effect on one's level of sports practice. You examine whether this effect differs for genuine soccer fans and not genuine soccer fans. You draw a random sample of people in which there are plenty who have attended a soccer game and those who have not attended. There are also plenty of fans and non-fans. You measure for each individual their physical activity after the soccer game. Other characteristics (e.g., gender, education level, age) of the individual are also available.  
  
Which statistical model is correct for this situation?

Answerlist
----------
* One-way ANOVA
* Regression with a moderation effect (interaction)
* One-way repeated measures ANOVA
* Mixed-design ANOVA

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------
* False
* True
* False
* False
